website_summaries.verdict: Smaller capacity than some other SSDs, but it'll work great for those who are on a tight budget.
pros: Beyond the 120 GB model, you can order this SSD in sizes up to 960 GB
Delivers a read speed up to 500 MB per second
Has some shock-absorption capabilities built into it, meaning it'll work well in a laptop
Slim form factor also fits well inside a laptop
cons: Write speed of 320 MB per second is slower than many other models
Not made for use with servers

customer_reviews.title: Kingston A400 SSD 480GB Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: As a 30-year+ computer guy, this is the only SSD drive I have ever purchased which worked perfectly when installed but failed totally with 2 weeks. I seriously recommend you spend a few more dollars and purchase a more dependable drive. While Kingston replaced the drive, (unit was outside the Amazon 30-day limit but was in my inventory a couple of months before I used it) I had to pay return shipping charges plus I now have another which I do not trust to use with a customer. Why did I buy it? Low sale price.
customer_reviews.author: DGS Florida

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and I could definitely see the difference having my operating system on it. However it stopped working after 5 months. Tried everything and after troubleshooting, I found out it has bad sectors that can't be repaired
customer_reviews.author: Fidele

customer_reviews.title: DOA. Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: DOA. The computer does not recognize the hard drive. I tried different computers to no avail. I ordered 2 of this at the same time because of its cheap price, but both are DOA. Very disappointed. Never had this kind of experience from amazon.com. I had purchased the same product 4 weeks ago which is working so far, and that's why I purchased 2 additional ones. I will stay away from this one from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Springbreeze

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD for the great price
customer_reviews.text: I was between this and Samsung 860 Evo, glad I got this. Just installed on Windows 10, Intel x79 chip, and you can find the speed test at the image I've attached right after initializing the disk. To be honest, I was expecting lower results. If you have and you can, plug this into intel (or amd, whatever) native chip, not 3rd party chips. My mainboard also has asmedia Sata3 6gbps chipset, but it's about 20% slower than Intel chipset even though they are both sata3 6gbps chipsets. I also wish this had at least some screws inside packaging, but no worries. In the case, it was only the disk. I had to find some screws salvaged from other places.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: I think it was a great value and a smart purchase
customer_reviews.text: The drive isn't lightning fast, but it is faster than a conventional disk, and it is rated faster than many competitors in this price range. I have been using Kingston memory sticks on my mainboards for years, and I have always found them fast and reliable. I expected the same performance from a Kingston drive, and now that I've been using it for awhile, I think it was a great value and a smart purchase. It is so small, and runs so cool that I didn't even bother to mount it in the case. I just left it hanging in the air by the SATA connector. Very good performance, very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Freeholder

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write a negative review especially with a brand that I normally never have problems with and quite enjoy their products. I bought this SSD thinking it was a really good deal for a storage device at the time. However with the SSD drive I recieved I have found that it will not connect to my computer, it doesn't show up in BIOS or device management. I've tried multiple ports and even a different computer entirely and nothing's getting it to show up. I'm not sure if there's a way that I can fix this but if I can and I will rewrite this review.
customer_reviews.author: Liam P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget SSD!
customer_reviews.text: This is currently the cheapest name brand 120gb ssd drive you can buy. I was on a tight budget so I decided to buy this instead of others that cost a bit more to save some money. I am very impressed with the speeds considering it's the cheapest ssd you can buy. I did run into some issues right off the bat. I was getting slow speeds, nearly as slow as my standard hard drive. After some research I found out that my sata controller was set to ide. After changing to achi I am now getting close to the advertised speeds. Boots windows 10 in 9 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Drive failed after 3 months with limited use, no warning. It just shows up as a 20MB drive now that cannot be initialized or partitioned. More than likely it is a controller reset which can only be fixed in house by manufacturer. However, under Kingston warranty terms, the customer must pay for return shipping. Pay $20 on a $30 drive? No thanks. Just won't buy Kingston anymore. I'll stick with more reputable brands from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Moohorns

customer_reviews.title: an awesome and stable 'bang for buck' ssd
customer_reviews.text: have been buying these ssd's from kingston for several clients over the last few generations of these ssd's. over the last 3 years I have not heard a single complaint from clients and for the price per unit I am satisfied with how they perform in my less expensive machines (sorry but for my $3000 desktop builds i go with samsung) I would highly recommend this product, over the 20-30 drives ive purchased in the last 3 years they have all held up well and maintain their performance.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: for the money... loose elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: this is one of those ssds that companies just dump their old parts into, they are totally prone to failure, please spend a bit more and get something that is more reliable, i returned this one after a friend had just told me about the specs and how he had one fail in 2 mo, which is totally unacceptable for an ssd
customer_reviews.author: Jack of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a hard drive with mixed results
customer_reviews.text: This SSD does read better than the 5400 hard drive. However, the write speed is all over the place. I replaced the hard drive on a Mac Mini to increase speed. The read speed increased by 4+ times according to Blackmagic 3.1 and was noticeable in the reduced startup of the computer and software. The write speed is from 190's to 30's. At this point, the main object changing to SSD of faster start times worked. Disappointed in write speed though. Added benefits include less heat and silent operation.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted for a good while, past 1 year of using it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year to upgrade my Thinkpad X230 and it's much better than a hard drive. Even though it is DRAM-less, it hasn't failed and provides pretty snappy performance for something this cheap. I would recommend the 240 GB drives in general because most 240 GB and higher drives are "higher end" than cheaper 128 GB drives. This one, is listed at 80 TBW (which I thought was quite low) but it still works even after several wipe downs and several windows installations. Though, my experience could mean I rolled a 6 with the dice, but I still think it's a pretty good SSD for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Kingston is a great storage option for those on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Will these Kingston ssd's outperform more "gamer" level ssd's not really. But what you get is a fast reliable storage solution that doesn't break the bank. I currently have 3 Kingston ssd's in my system (2x240g, plus a 240g M.2) they are great and I always use them in any builds that I do, it makes those systems just that much more snappy. I've purchased I believe 7 of them and have only had one fail on me. They are a good mid range option for those that want to dip their toes in solid state storage. They certainly will make older systems using a HDD seem so much faster. I would certainly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stoneweaver28

customer_reviews.title: Drive Failure - No Response to Warranty Claim
customer_reviews.text: I understand that any component can fail, but when one of these crapped out after just a few months of use I expected the warranty claim and replacement to be quick and easy. It's been neither. Filed with them online over a week ago and there has been zero response. Yes, I checked my SPAM folder. So I will keep this one on my desk as a reminder to never buy another Kingston product and move on.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Dead Drive
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to installing the SSD and it’s completely dead. No wonder these have been put on sale. Missed the return window to Amazon or I’d return it.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBug

customer_reviews.title: Kingston A400 SSD 480GB
customer_reviews.text: Installed these Kingston A400 Drives into 2 separate Dell Optiplex 990 Tower PC's. One works flawlessly, the other now constantly crashes, and mostly when copying large files to the SSD. This is the only problem that I have had when using these Solid State Drives; I have installed over a dozen of them in various units this year without any problems. Until now.. Overall; they are very good drives, and I guess one out of 14 isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.S..

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly to breath new life in an old gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: i have a 2012 alienware desktop that i used for a long time for games and video editing. it had a RAID setup with 3 western digital black hard drives, but it was finally time to get some SSDs in there. this one is used for the basic OS since that's very low use and all my games are on the data disks which are samsung 860 EVO ssds. for the price, this was like a night and day difference on boot times and getting all my basic windows stuff and editors (installed on C:) running fast and smooth. best money spent on an upgrade with the biggest difference.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz C.

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent failures, randomly won't show in UEFI. Less than a month old.
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with this Kinston SSD. Win 10 finally installed, but with much frustration, using USB; then froze after a days use. Re-installed Win 10 and the SSD randomly dropped from SATA controller again after a few days. ASUS motherboard with AHCI set in EUFI. The seven year old OCZ SSD this was supposed to replace boots just fine with Win 7, so I know it's not my system.
customer_reviews.author: IronMan

customer_reviews.title: Received an open unit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for the OS partition on a home server because it was cheap... Mine was opened and had 186 hours on it, 52 power cycles, 9 bad blocks reported, and wear leveling stat was already showing the drive at 99% health. I'm keeping it to run tests on it and see how it continues to degrade but the unit was obviously returned then restocked without testing. Buyer beware. I know these can come with bad blocks and these don't seem to be harmful or growing, but I'm not really a fan of getting an opened one with a week of use that someone else returned showing less than 100% health.
customer_reviews.author: duke

customer_reviews.title: Great budget ssd option for speeding up an old computer
customer_reviews.text: I had a 13'' 2010 macbook pro with a dead hard drive. These machines are very easy to open up and I installed the ssd in a matter of minutes (or seconds). I suggest an ifixit pro tech toolkit for the install. Once I wiped the drive in macos recovery (booting from a time machine backup drive) I installed mac os high sierra (highest supported on the particular machine) and I was up and running. The computer now boots in seconds rather than minutes. Overall, this is a very good ssd especially for the price, and I would buy it again if I needed to speed up another machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: 1.9+GB SSD working as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD so that I have storage needed for booting dual OS's on my laptop. I connected it to an open SATA 3 slot and rebooted into Linux, set it up in GParted as EXT4 as this will be my main drive and transferred about 200GB of data at around 330MB/s, which is about what I am used to on this machine. If you don't really get all of that, it works at a standard SSD speed as intended without any issues out of the box, which is many times faster than a traditional HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Brien

customer_reviews.title: Have one in both my laptop and desktop
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of the 120gb kingston ssd's back a year ago for my budget i3 laptop. It was great, i was extremely happy with the improvement (even paying 2x what it costs currently.) When i had seen that the price had dropped down to it's current 19.99 i had to get one for my work computer. I was unsure how much improvement i would see because it's an older "core two duo" but right away i notice the sound reduction is tremendous. I don't really know how to do benchmarks on computers, but if you want a nonsensical value, i'll say it's now 3 gigabits faster than it previously was. very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: died on me after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: My product review is in regards of MY ssd, not the ssd in general. the SSD is great and ran programs fast for me. But mine died after just 6 months of use. wasn't reading on disk management or device management. I couldn't find it anywhere. Low key salty I bought it at $50 then it drops to $30 too, thought I was getting my money's worth, and for 6 months I was. Kingston customer service was really long to get a hold of but they were all very polite and friendly so thats always nice.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price. But lacking software.
customer_reviews.text: These are great SSDs for the price. I've now purchased 6-7 of these. But there are a few problems with getting the cheapest name brand SSD out there. Software. Most other SSDs come with access to cloning software for free. I know SanDisk, Western digital, and Samsung all have easy to use utilities for cloning your OS drive to your new SSD. So if you don't have the know how or the software to clone your drive maybe spend a few dollars more for a drive that comes with a nice utility. I'm a system admin so I have no problem imaging the drive myself but I remember my first time cloning a drive and it was hard.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Super-charged my Mid-2011 Apple Mac Mini !
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading more memory (now 8 gigs) in my 2011 Apple MacMini, I thought I would replace the 500gig standard hard drive with this SSD 120gig drive. I really don't need more space than that as I save all my personal files to an external drive. After installing this SSD drive and upgrading the OS to Apple High Sierra, I tested it side-by-side with my 2015 Apple Macbook Pro 13 inch laptop also running High Sierra and... it equaled or BEAT the Macbook (which is four years newer) !!!! WOW!!! A GREAT investment that will make this Mac Mini useful for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: hated packaging and lack of included things
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased drives for my computer for decades now. Every drive I have ever purchased included adapters for different power supplies and even data ribbon cables. Included software to both manage your drive and aid in cloning existing drive if needed. Package was VERY small with no extra freebees. hooked it up intended use was a slave and it worked flawless without changing anything. opening up an important device like this for your computer should feel more exciting than opening a candybar, in some cases a candy bar has better packaging than this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pacific NorthWest

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old one
customer_reviews.text: When my laptop fell off the end table it begin to develop problems Loading pages and streaming issues.I could hear an internal clicking type noise. My nephew suggested that it was probably the hard drive, because they’ve been known to have this kind of problem. As it turned out there was a slight variation in the tray that The new one slid into. With a little trimming it seemed to work fine. Overall it ended up working just great. Since I was contemplating on buying a new laptop, this ended up being a cheap fix and restoring my older laptop. I am pleased and have had no issues with it now for over a year
customer_reviews.author: ardentone

customer_reviews.title: The price is nearly unbeatable and the drive is stable.
customer_reviews.text: I use this model specifically for its encryption abilities and it's price point. It allows me to create live environments that I can take with me on the go for repairs and diagnostics (( when the toaster burns one side more than the other )). I often use these to copy the drives of computers that have, "hard to find" proprietary software and drivers. It allows for an affordable restoration should anything at all go wrong. I've never had an issue offline cloning to these drives. I also haven't had one die before yet, so I don't know how upset I will be when that happens. All good for now.
customer_reviews.author: Squatch

customer_reviews.title: Should've bought it years ago
customer_reviews.text: Recently my OEM hard drive on my 2011 Mac Mini died, so I decided to go with SSD as it will speed up the overall performance of aging computer. Since I don't need a lot of storage space (original was 500GB with only 120GB used) I decided to down-size to just 250GB to lower my cost. I'm so glad I went with SSD instead of traditional HD. The responsiveness of my old Mac Mini increased so much it felt like a brand new computer. Everything was much faster--from login, to surfing the web, to switching apps. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Fast boot up drive at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Kingston is always my go-to brand for drives when I'm trying to save. Their quality is great especially when you're paying maybe $25 for some drives. Obviously this drive makes booting up crazy fast. Since it's only 120, maybe 118 with actual space, it's a great drive to keep windows on & any other important software you need to get to quickly. I've always used them for booting as they're reliable and relatively fast. They'll seriously revive your slow computer. I've also used them as portable drives since some are only $20 and you get a decent work size.
customer_reviews.author: Chris V

customer_reviews.title: Was great for almost a yr, now lots of errors
customer_reviews.text: Pooped out and it hasn't been a year yet... Blue screens and errors all the time.. Checked and Google everything to fix it and even wiped out and did a clean windows install but still error mgs and freezes. Don't buy if you want longevity in your ssd
customer_reviews.author: Ayu_tenshi177

customer_reviews.title: Great Support, not working in certain HP's
customer_reviews.text: Kingston has top notch support. They tried to help troubleshoot the problem. But it turns out HP envy m7-n109dx has a slot for M.2 ssd but it is deliberately disabled. I found this first hand and reading online. Kingston was not aware of this either. If you have this PC, use the extra 2.5" ssd port they offer. You'll need an adapter for the 2.5", the proper one is $25, I used the amazon part ASIN B0832GQVFG for about half that and some soft silicone weatherstripping to hold it in the case. Worked fine. Assuming it does work, they should include the mounting screw, hence 4 stars on installing. Otherwise you must find your own screw.
customer_reviews.author: jmpaul

customer_reviews.title: a slow SSD
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Kingston Digital 240GB SSDNow V300 SATA 3 2.5 (7mm height) Solid State Drive (SV300S37A/240G) to the Kingston A400 SSD 480GB SATA 3 2.5” Solid State Drive SA400S37/480G to increase storage space and keep performance. wow!! what a difference the NEW SSD is constantly trying to catch up where as the older 240GM SSDNow never had that issue wish I had seen this coming, probably would have bought a different brand
customer_reviews.author: rebelbah

customer_reviews.title: Failed less than 6 months into use
customer_reviews.text: This computer was used primarily for work purposes, and as such was only used the three days a week that we are open. However, the laptop will now no longer recognize the SSD as a bootable drive, and gives me an error when trying to load my OS. Another reviewer says this SSD is not configured to be used as a bootable drive, and I am inclined to agree with him. While it is cheap, this SSD failing after less than 6 months should be very worrying for those who are looking to purchase this SSD as a primary OS drive.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Yu

customer_reviews.title: Boot drive for three computers!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to save $$$ and do not need a NVMe or M.2 SATA, this is a great boot drive. PC boots in about 6-8 seconds with 8GB of RAM with a i3-8100 processor. Moving a 13GB file to another location in the drive took about 9 seconds. If using for storage, the capacity will fill up rather quickly, so take that into consideration. After installing two games (around 80GB each), the drive was almost full. I have no clue why it asked me to rate the “battery life” in all honesty, but I gave it 5 stars because it is infinite on SATA power (laughs).
customer_reviews.author: Raf C

customer_reviews.title: Older laptop needed a ssd
customer_reviews.text: I like that this ssd was cheap and came quickly. I needef it because my dad's laptop gas older hardware, and Win 10 was bogging it down on his hdd. Originally I was just going to image his old drive, but with the older hardware I decided to just put LinuxMint on it. My dad is 77, all he uses is the web browser for simple tasks, so this was a great solution to keep his older laptop up to speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mutant Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and LIGHTNING Fast!  Very Economical for "Breathing New Life" Into an Aging PC.
customer_reviews.text: Finally swapped out the slow, antiquated 7200RPM HDD in my HP EliteBook Folio 9480m. The computer boots up in seconds now, and is ready to start using immediately, unlike the original hard drive, which took at least a few MINUTES to fully boot and be usable. I was getting so frustrated with the original HDD's speed (or lack thereof), I hadn't been using the PC much. That will change now, however! Installation was a breeze, Windows 10 installed flawlessly, and the system never hangs, even when under a heavy load! Would totally recommend and buy again. Kingston is a good company; I also have some thumb drives made by them that work great.
customer_reviews.author: Random Buyer (An Actual Person!)

customer_reviews.title: I was right and she was wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Put it in a clapped out laptop because the girlfriend wouldn't belive me that it would make such a huge difference in speed. Yeah 30$ ssd saved her from buying a new 400$ laptop for school. One of those crazy times where I was right and she was wrong and admitted it. But if you're looking to upgrade your computer from a hdd to and ssd, just do it and pick a reliable name. I've never had a problem with Kingston, have a few Samsung drives and 2 crashed on me so not a huge fan. But ssd's are great. Smaller, and unbelievably faster and if it means speeding up a old computer, why not.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: This Drive Died Very Quickly, was defective. AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this purchase. I got the 120gb A400 model as a boot drive for Windows 10. I noticed a small dent in the SSD Casing but thought noting of it. After just 2 months it began showing signs of failure i/o errors and Inaccessible Boot Device BSODs... I made sure nothing else was failing by running all the proper tests. It was the SSD in short. So i purchased a different brand because i was just barely outside the "Product Support / Return" windows. So i lost my Windows 10 install, pics, documents, software, ect..... Not happy but i work on PCs daily so The PC is running with a better, different SSD now
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for server environments.
customer_reviews.text: I intended to use this for a server, but the fine print on the package informs me that this is not intended for server environments. There is nothing on this product page that mentioned this fact. Apart from that, this is a decent SSD. It may not be bootable depending on what you have. It sports a good metal case. Some of you might not care for the dust-metal texture of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I feel about these cheap buggers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on February 9, 2019 and installed the first one a few days after that. The second one I started using about 6 months ago. I've started about a month ago having memory write errors and then bsod's from the first drive. Granted it can be a number of things from the poor wiring in my home that causes power surges (My pc is on a UPS so it /shouldn't/ be an issue.) to faulty win10 updates. But I still feel that with only a little over years use close to two years it shouldn't be at 11% wear already.
customer_reviews.author: Kuz

customer_reviews.title: No transfer software, you're on your own
customer_reviews.text: Just an FYI: The product shows an instructional video for Acronis True Image Free to clone your disk, but that doesn't appear to work anymore. I am using the 30-day trial of Macrium Reflect to clone my disk, I've use it in the past successfully. It requires that you understand how to re-partition your disk, so you may run into a challenge unless you are familiar with disk structure.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Great Linux Drive!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired network engineer. 49 yrs in the industry. BUT I am also a gamer. Gaming online since 94. So this drive was perfect to install Linunx Mint 20 on and install Vulkan drivers. Nice, really nice So not this machine dual boots to Windows 10 and Linux Mint 20. Very cost effective. A lot of space to install on. And much faster than I thought it would be. A nice surprise. So I'm happy all the way around. So would I recommend this drive to other? Oh yeah. This is not only a good driver for 2nd drive. It's good as a primary!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Grimes

customer_reviews.title: IT'S NOT 240GB!!!!!  Only 222GB
customer_reviews.text: For the price it I cant really complain and it works for what I needed it for. I won't make too big a stink. I replaced the HD in and older model HP laptop so my 1st grader could do school from home. For that it gets a pass. Just be warned you're working with 222 GB not 240 GB which I feel is a bit deceptive. It appears most know this. I'm not a techy I just bought a cheap SSD with good reviews. I do see people saying it's not a boot drive however I accomplished being able to use it as a boot drive.
customer_reviews.author: Big D~

customer_reviews.title: This drive has ruined my life...
customer_reviews.text: I had been hearing about how amazing a solid state drive (SSD) is with your Windows OS installed on it, so I out this drive in my PC and did just this. My startup time went from about 2 minutes to 20 seconds, no exaggeration. I've been ruined! I'm a total snob now. I will NEVER buy another PC without an SSD in it. It changed my life. I've been using this drive for over a year on almost a daily basis. It works great. Price was great, but I sort of wish I'd sprung for one with a little more storage space.
customer_reviews.author: DrumBum

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: Premium/reliable brand, inexpensive, great reviews/ratings. I've installed several SSDs for friends and coworkers and can't tell a difference in the various advertised speeds of the different SSDs when it comes to installing Windows and running daily tasks like web browsing, Word, Excel, etc. Let me also state that I only use what I consider reputable/premium brands (Samsung, Sandisk, PNY, Kingston, etc). If you want the best and don't mind spending double, do your research on reputable sites. Before installing more RAM or swapping out your processor, SSDs are THE goto for upgrading an aging computer now. Do not trash your old laptop or desktop, just install one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great value to upgrade a PC or laptop
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade the hard drive on a small PC. I priced several SSD's and decided to try this one out at the price-to-good review ratio seemed good to me. I do not regret my decision. Package came on time. Installation was very easy. And it works like a charm. My old PC has new life in it now. In laymen terms, its almost like changing out the engine in an old vehicle for something faster, better MPG, and starting at 0 miles. I bought the 256GB and its plenty enough for emails and some web browsing. This was used for a secretaries office at my local church. They love it. Would also work on a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Perez

customer_reviews.title: No cloning software, ridiculous.... Read thoroughly before you purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Nobody's fault but my own; I purchased this ssd to replace the hard drive in my grandson's computer. Had I known it did not come with cloning software I never would have purchased it. Hopefully this review helps someone else avoid the mistake I made. I don't understand why it doesn't come with cloning software. Shame on you Kingston. I have read that Samsung ssd's do come with the software. Check them out before purchasing this one.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Used on my Dell Inspiron 3135
customer_reviews.text: Made this Dell Laptop thats never ran well, a very usable Laptop. The touchscreen is suddenly responsive and for the 1st time in this laptops life it is snappy and responsive. Battery life jumped greatly cause its no longer spinning a disk drive. Specs on this machine are 4 gb ram, A quad core 1 ghz processor, nothing special. Pretty sure ive had close to 8 hours run time today on a 5 year old laptop battery. If you've though about putting an SSD in to bring life back into an old laptop , Just do it. If specs this low see such a vast improvment anything above it will be even better. Most laptops use 2.5 inch drives.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Stalcup

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to breathe life into a slow computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought a laptop a few years before SSDs became commonplace. It has great specs as a 2-in-1 but I noticed it was running slow during startup and opening various programs. Did some diagnostics and found out the HDD was suffering from abysmally slow read/write speeds, which was slowing everything down. Swapped it for this SSD, reinstalled Windows and all my programs, and the laptop is lightning fast now. If you've got a computer from the past few years and it's running slow, don't be so quick to replace the whole thing... do your homework, run some tests, and if the HDD is the problem, just swap it for this!
customer_reviews.author: Parth

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with the performance for the price. Purchased the 240GB model, for an older computer. Didn't want to use a slow hard drive any longer. Benchmarked the drive using a motherboard with SATA 6 gbps, and another with SATA 3 gbps. =============================== CrystalDiskMark 6.0.1 x64, SATA 6 gbps =============================== Read / Write [MB/s] Seq Q32T1: 555.6 / 488.1 4KiB Q8T8: 286.9 / 349.3 4KiB Q32T1: 172.6 / 160.3 4KiB Q1T1: 33.01 / 78.13 =============================== CrystalDiskMark 6.0.2 x64, SATA 3 gbps =============================== Read / Write [MB/s] Seq Q32T1: 275.8 / 273.2 4KiB Q8T8: 210.3 / 201.4 4KiB Q32T1: 107.8 / 99.75 4KiB Q1T1: 26.32 / 48.91
customer_reviews.author: Chris K.

customer_reviews.title: Writing capabilities misleading
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this drive is pretty good except for the writing speed. I don't understand why but whenever I write more than 5 gigabytes at a time on the SSD it slows down to a crawl. It starts at a modest speed of 300 MB/s for the first few gigabyte writes then slows down to less than 80 MB/s after. I could imagine that for most people this would be reasonable, since they are not writing multi-gigabytes of data everyday. However its still pretty frustrating that just installing a new game or even downloading multiple videos could cause the system to come to a halt, due to the cache memory running out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for Linux users.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for installing Linux on older laptops. The OS always installs just fine but the laptops never recognize the SSD as a bootable drive. I have tried several laptops, all with the latest BIOS version. I also verified on a Windows 10 machine that the firmware on this SSD is up to date. This SSD has wasted many hours of my time. I do not recommend this SSD for Linux users.
customer_reviews.author: cgwatson79

customer_reviews.title: IT specialist approved.
customer_reviews.text: i purposely held my review for over a year,because of bad reviews i was skeptical, but I've been using these for more than a yr, have a few of these actually, 1 in my gaming rig as a boot drive, 1 in my laptop for work and school, 1 in my media pc, and it works right out of the box, windows and linux installs were a breeze, non has failed on me yet, and I've experienced no hiccups. great product
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: First read about "Kingston SSD not showing in bios"
customer_reviews.text: I will say that the drive works flawlessly. Initially however I had a hard time getting bios to recognize the drive. I started and stopped the computer so many times checking interior connections that I damaged one of my memory sticks and corrupted some file that prevented OS (win10) from starting. I eventually had to reinstall the OS. I then found out that with Kingston you have to go into settings and computer management and format the drive before it will be recognized by the bios. Now this is what I had to to do with MY PC.
customer_reviews.author: aduckfan

customer_reviews.title: It's a small, SATA 3 120gb SSD:
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace an old, noisy mechanical hard drive I stuffed into a Dell Optiplex 3040 I'm using as a pfSense box. Is it the fastest SSD on the market? No, not even close! Is it the biggest capacity? Definitely not! Do I care? No! Does it run pfSense? YES! After checking it for bad blocks, there were none, I installed pfSense on it and fired it up. pfSense boots in less than a minute - but it did that before with the mechanical hard drive...but now it's quieter! That's all I wanted, and that's what I got. With everything else off in the room, you can now barely hear the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: I must ammend my review. Actually a really good hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought the hard drive failed but it turns out ( I just now found out) it was the computer motherboard. So, I apologize for the harsh review posted before. I have since installed this drive into another computer that I use as the main hard drive for the OS in an NVR (Network Video Recorder) and it is working great. NVRs are hard on hard drives and they tend to die often so the fact that this one is still going is a pretty good testiment to it's quality.
customer_reviews.author: GARY in Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: So, I just needed the cheapest decent storage solution I could find for a firewall running on an old i3 workstation. For 20 bucks, I certainly can't complain. I'll update if it gives me any trouble, but so far so good. Doesn't make a difference for normal operation, but I have to say it's a lot more responsive popping around the menus than whatever (probably flash) they load the OS on in the hardware appliances I manage. Seems like a small one like I got would be a good boot drive for a low budget system.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K

customer_reviews.title: vastly improved grandma's laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Grandma had replaced her laptop with better case and screen for her eyes. However, the laptop went from using an SSD to using a 5400RPM spinning disk. More space, but waaaaaay slower. She didnt need the extra space. When she asked for help, i got to rebuilding it with upgraded RAM, a thorough cleaning, and a new SSD. This SSD was inexpensive and plenty fast. After re-imaging the laptop, I went ahead and updated it fully, cleared out the garbage and optimized everything for the new drive. She's much happier with it and I put the 5400RPM in an external enclosure so she can run backups!
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Kingston SSD! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great SSD. I like it. I was able to upgrade from a HDD to a SSD, my HDD was very slow. I had a particular laptop that I wanted upgrade to SSD drive, so I bought this and it worked. Note that if you saw my profile, than I bought other SSD’s. I used that to upgrade my other device’s from HDD to SSD. The only Con was it only came with the SSD, I thought it would include cloning software. But I think all SSDs is that way and it’s normal. But Great SSD, I Highly Recommend to people who are upgrading to an SSD drive!
customer_reviews.author: Art Fofanov

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: The single best upgrade you can make to a computer is replacing that mechanical drive with a SSD, I can't say who makes the best SSD, because any SSD works so fast that the rest of the computer becomes the performance bottleneck...and in 5 years of installing SSD hard disks exclusively in my computers I've never had one fail (knock on wood). My two favorite upgrades are installing SSD and maxing RAM to capacity of the computer, and I do them with every computer I get...my very first SSD, which I put in a laptop running Linux, is still going strong 5 years later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my laptop and the system was able to see it. I tried multiple OS installers and they all returned errors during partitioning that stated the SSD was bad. Just to test one of the installers on the previous HDD to make sure it wasn't the culprit and it worked fine. Here's to hoping I can get a refund. This was not my first SSD, though it is the first one to fail. All of the desktop systems in my house have an SSD and I was the one to install the operating systems. I've been able to install Windows 7, Windows 10, and Debian/Linux on them without failures.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: On both my IMac and MacBook Pro these were a pain to install. Possible user error, but I ended up using Carbon Copy Cloner to get the drives running. When I tried to boot into recovery and install fresh, the end product was always a gray screen with a circle and line through it. (Yes I formatted the disks). Either way, it was a pain for me. Speeds are about 200s read and write (definitely not 10x faster). Overall for $50 I guess I’m ok with them. Still questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Charles

customer_reviews.title: Always a reliable brand, good price, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Always a reliable brand, good price, good quality, not too much else to say, 100 percent recommend this item. I have bought many of these in various capacities, all are of excellent quality. Always check the read/write speeds in the specs if that's important to you. those speeds vary depending on the model and price. I have used these SSDs in my budget computers and every crystal disk mark test has resulted in up-to-spec results. Like i said, 100 percent recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Glarbinstin

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Perfect price for the size. Only needed it for a laptop that basically only goes online. Did not need huge storage space, just the speed of an SSD. Did not need state of the art technology like the EVO drives offer, don't need to spend that kind of money. If the drive ever fails, no problem, mother is not storing any photos, documents or music, or anything on laptop. Just for shopping, browsing, and Microsoft Rewards. This drive was perfect for the application I needed it for. DEFINATILY NOT fast like an EVO - with disc magician activated. Yet this drive WILL make an old laptop NEW again.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Great Quality, All Relative
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I have not used this product yet, but have used Kingston and other SSD manufacturers for awhile. I just thought it important to state the the difference between different SSD architectures/designs. When it comes to SSD's don't spend an arm and a leg, you can compare speeds and storage sizes, but in the end they are very similar and it is rare that you will need to spend extra money. This hard drive is great for a boot drive, loading the operating system and a few games, just make sure to get a cheap HDD for storage, Western Digital is good quality around $44 per TB
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first SSD
customer_reviews.text: I recently built the family a new desktop PC for schoolwork and gaming. I bought the 480GB drive which was reasonably priced for the capacity. This drive will hold most of our programs and system files. A standard drive will house data files. I probably should have sized up since that drive space is quickly gobbled up but I was building on a budget. I’m happy with the performance. It boots and loads programs at a good speed. I’ve so far been pleased with the performance of Kingston drives.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Fast Boot
customer_reviews.text: I recently acquired a HP 2000 laptop from a friend with win 7 4gig ram 320 gig HDD and miserably slow. Boot time of 3:45 from cold boot to PW. Installed win 10 and boot time went up to 2:00, still sucked, so I purchased this SSD [Kingston 240GB A400 ] then cloned my existing HDD to the SSD , installed it and now my boot time is 13 sec to PW screen. This is the best upgrade I have ever done on a computer. Cant give a higher recommendation. A very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: JimiZ

customer_reviews.title: Mid grade for casual computing
customer_reviews.text: This is a mid-grade SSD drive that I would recommend for casual computing; not for gaming. Under heavy usage, the SSD has a tendency to lock-up and freeze the system. Under moderate usage, its reasonably fast and functions accordingly. If you purchase this, I would back-up your data often.
customer_reviews.author: Danesp

customer_reviews.title: No problems - 4R's
customer_reviews.text: Working just fine for me. Super easy install. I used this and 4Gb of ram on a 2011 Dell laptop and easily breathed new life to it and will easily serve my needs. Super fast bootup and programs perform quite well. 4 R's - Reduce , Reuse, Recycle and Repurpose. This old laptop was still perfectly operational. Alot of those electronics recycling outfits just merely crush these fully functional machines or send em off to India so low-wage workers can crush them in home-made outfits that release TONS of toxic materials.
customer_reviews.author: L11

customer_reviews.title: It's 2019, get an SSD...
customer_reviews.text: Ssd's are required nowadays. Doesn't matter what kinda pic it is whether it's 4 or 9 years old an SSD will make a HUGE difference. I've been purchasing Kingston ssds for awhile now and they are by far the most affordable and reliable on the market. If your looking for that bit of extra performance Samsung Evo is the way to go but these are just fine for about anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: SSD has held up well and boot time reduced by more than 70%
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cost effective way to rejuvenate an older computer. On my 5 year old portable computer with a platter hard drive, boot time exceeded 90 seconds. After cloning and installing this SSD, boot time now is between 18-20 seconds! OK, I did a little tweaking by turning off Prefetch and Superfetch services (recommended when an SSD is installed as boot drive) and performing a "Disk Cleanup" and including system files. However, the portable now feels and operates with more "Pep!"
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Reader

customer_reviews.title: Revitalized my old laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go along with a Windows 10 upgrade on my old HP laptop that was running Vista! I did have a couple issue with Win 10 but not related to the SSD. Once I figured out that my old computer wouldn't run the 1809 version of Win 10 and I used the 1803 version everything works perfectly! The laptop boots up in 15-20 seconds or so and runs way better then ever before. The system runs much cooler now too. Keep in mind that this laptop is quite old, runs an Intel Centrino Duo 2ghz processor and 2 gigs or ram. It is now quite serviceable for surfing the web and basic computing needs.
customer_reviews.author: rcktpwrd

customer_reviews.title: Vr videos
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and play videos great. I primarily use this for storage of adult videos to view on the oculus and this thing single handedly has sped up the process faster than any other upgrade. I'll update the review later but for its 45 seconds of use everyday, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a hard drive in a laptop that was 10 years old that I no loner used. The laptop was too slow to be of any value. After the replacement, the boot time went from minutes to seconds. The old laptop was actually faster than my two year old laptop with more memory and a faster processor. I immediately ordered a 1TB SSD for my newer laptop and the results were staggering. For what it's worth, I will never buy another computer without a SSD drive.
customer_reviews.author: tberry

customer_reviews.title: Great OS drive in Linux media server
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the operating system drive in a Linux media server combined with a Crucial MX500 1TB SSD. Low power, low heat, quiet operation. Sits in the living room and the wife didn't even notice it for over a week.
customer_reviews.author: T. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great little drive for upgrading older machines
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to put in an Arcade machine that had an 80GB Hitachi hard drive in it originally. Boot times with the spinning disk were just over 3 minutes. With this SSD, boot time dropped to just under 2 minutes, so it still wasn't instant boot, but it's a heck of a lot quicker! The computer running this system is old (celeron 2Ghz on an old Intel D865GLC motherboard), so throwing a better SSD at it didn't make any sense, and frankly I wanted to upgrade it as cheaply as possible, anyhow. For an older computer, or something that only sees light use like web surfing, etc, I don't think you can go wrong with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foust

customer_reviews.title: it has terrible freezing issues
customer_reviews.text: got this on Cyber Monday. fresh installed windows 10 on it. and since day one it has terrible freezing problem. read multiple articles about how to fix issues but at this moment im just pretty sure its just Hardware issue and not software. system randomly freezes for ~10 seconds or so. and it happens multiple times , so annoying when you are trying to work. really disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Otar Otkhozoria

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for old desktops alongside a larger hard disk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my desktop has a 750 GB spinning hard drive, which I now only use for my home directory under Linux (personal data). Installing Linux to this SSD dramatically improved boot and application loading times on my 10 year old PC. I wouldn't use this in a laptop due to the small size, but using this as a boot drive alongside a larger spinning hard drive is a cheap way to speed up a desktop machine. You will need a mounting bracket in most desktops though since SSDs are typically laptop-sized.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly fast Windows 10 restore...
customer_reviews.text: When another brand of SSD failed a few weeks ago, I purchased this as its replacement. Restoring from an image backup via a USB-attached drive only took 4 minutes! In my experience, Kingston SSDs have proven very reliable. I still have some older Kingston HyperX drives from about 2012 that are working today. The other brand that failed me was newer than that... Although I question their logo - a bearded guy with his skull missing - the drive is great!
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: This drive was used for 1 and a half hour in a casual internet browsing session on a spare computer and after making sure everything works well, that computer was shut down and battery removed from it. Now after a while, I took that computer out and tried to power it up and the drive failed to load! Took it out and tested it externally and it is dead. I replaced it with Samsung 860 Evo in the same computer to see if it's the computer's fault or the drive was faulty. But after 6 months of regular use, the drive is fine. This Kingston drive disappointed me big time! AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!
customer_reviews.author: Safwan Khan

customer_reviews.title: Improved my Youtube 60fps and 'near' 4K Experience.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and setup. For my application, I cloned my magnetic drive to the SSD easily on a "workbench" PC that I already have MiniTool Partition Wizard on. I truly believe the SSD is a good performer and I would be inclined to buy again for another machine. This one was for a HTPC (yes, I still have one in light of Rokus, Fire sticks, etc.) and it was able to help Youtube download speeds of 1080p 60 fps video and 'near 4K' video be much faster for my 2GB video card to be able to render it without much stuttering on my late 2010s Dell slim PC (streaming using Chrome...Firefox I like better but 60fps video stutters).
customer_reviews.author: Ray L. Perry III

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade to a 2014 HP laptop
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in a 2014 HP laptop its new again speeds right through now. Best upgrade I ever done. Took the Old 1TB spinning Hard Drive and put it over in the CD DVD bay ( with the help of an adapter kit )that I Never used and used it as secondary storage. Got a 240 gig boot SSD with the O/S( Windows 10 64 Bit) and a old 1 TB games and miscellaneous stuff drive.
customer_reviews.author: Don Trail

customer_reviews.title: Always happy with Kingston!
customer_reviews.text: Never been disappointed with Kingston products. This is no exception. Good value, solid build, great performance. I purchased 2 and both have been installed in separate machines, so far excellent results. Pics are Intel NUC installation; perfect fit and function. Very satisfied with these SSD's!
customer_reviews.author: bikin fool

customer_reviews.title: Helped performance of parents computer!
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a budget ssd, It has improved the performer of my parents computer by an astounding amount. Recently I noticed my parents computer was running very slow even though it is not that old and had a decent CPU / enough ram. I checked and saw that the disk usage was always at 99%. Once I put this device in, it immediately improved performance and allows my parents to better use it, which has made them much happier. Is this the top of the line SSD? No of course not, but it is extremely cheap and fast enough for almost all users. I would recommend this product as a great budget ssd!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Big gains, with no headache.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this drive to replace a slowing, aging drive. I heard some popular computer/tech reviewers online raving about SSD's and decided to try this one out. Its definitely WAY faster than my old spinning disc drive, and has made Windows 10 a smooth experience even on a 12 year old laptop. I'm not super tech guy, but If you want to get rid of an old spinning drive, with something WAY lighter, faster, that won't increase temperatures this would definitely work. I plan on buying one or two more, especially if the larger sizes drop in price soon.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence G.

customer_reviews.title: Revitalize an oldie but goodie
customer_reviews.text: This HDD went into a 6-year-old Dell Optiplex 7010 which had some decent specs other than the original spinning platter. With an upgrade to W10 and this HDD, this rig is now competent to be a daily driver again for CAD/CAM and whatever else I throw at it. I chose the smaller drive because it was only about $20 bucks and I'm keeping the old HDD as storage. I definitely recommend so far, time will tell if it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Worked in Macbook
customer_reviews.text: Now that SSD prices are coming down for a usable amount of storage I picked up one of these on sale. I just wanted to upgrade the storage in my 2009 MacBook. I used a cloning program with a SATA cable I had on another external drive that made the install incredibly easy. Once I had cloned the HD onto this SSD I just installed it and fired it up with no issues. This seems to be a little faster than the 256gb SSD I already had, and it's nice to have more storage now to keep more photos and movies onboard for faster loading.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Budget SSD Choice for PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive in my PS4 Pro. I was waiting for a reasonably priced drive to hit the market with more space than the standard 1TB 5400RPM HDD that came stock with the console. First thing you notice is how light and thin it is. Since it is not 2TB and it’s 1.92TB, Kingston can charge a bit less than the competition. The PS4 Pro has a bottleneck with regards to speed so you don’t need the fastest SSD, just a SSD is fine. Kingston even has a YouTube video with step by step instructions on how to swap the drives. Overall, an excellent value. My console feels twice as fast now and has much more storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: This breathed new life into my Core 2 Duo machine. It's a much more effective upgrade than adding RAM. Since Windows will always make a swap file, regardless of how much RAM you have, this speeds that up as well. Restart time went from 5 minutes to 90 seconds. Programs load much faster. Since I have a 12TB NAS and a 500GB HHD also in the machine, I don't need a large Windows drive. If a SSD would be your only drive, you may want something larger.
customer_reviews.author: vab251

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget-Friendly SSD
customer_reviews.text: Works as you'd expect! Get the size that you need. Easy to install, works wonderfully quick for OS startup and for games loaded on this SSD. Keep in mind that if you are building a gaming PC and get a smaller SSD, you will need a hard disk drive (HDD) to store additional files/games on.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: I used this to revive an OLD Asus laptop I had kicking around. It's amazing how this drive 120GB brought the old laptop back to life -- it's very fast now. Granted, as far as SSDs go, this isn't the fastest drive and I wouldn't use it in my gaming PC, but if all you're using it for is to replace a spinning drive, you'll notice a significant speed improvement. I already bought a 240GB version for another old laptop I have. And I'm not sure what the one review who says this doesn't work as a boot drive is talking about -- I use it as a boot drive and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Tolerances - Unusable
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue how this sold state drive performs because I didn't manage to make it that far. I cannot install this into my laptop because the tolerances are so awful that the screw holes don't line up with the standard placement for screws. I tried to make it work, but I couldn't. At the end of the day, all I achieved was stripping a screw on my laptop's hard drive caddy and rubbing a hole in one of the rubber parts. So now I need to replace this AND my hard drive caddy. Thanks, Kingston for the damage your product did to my laptop. I really appreciate it...
customer_reviews.author: Peter Miller

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective upgrade for your Windows 'C' drive.
customer_reviews.text: The newer updates to Windows 10 do a lot of VM work, and I found my older family PCs and laptops were bogging down with 100% hard disk usage for minutes at a time. The CPUs were nowhere near their full capacity, so new motherboards would not have helped. The solution was to speed up the paging by fitting these SSDs as the system disk (for the laptop, the only disk), and upgrading the memory to 8GB to minimise the need for paging. Very cost-effective, and I made external USB3 portable drives out of the old disks.
customer_reviews.author: M. V. Indrasoma

customer_reviews.title: So far so good despite some bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and price to perk up my VISTA era Thinkpad now running Mint Linux. Very easy to install, load and configure with new OS. Can't beat the price for a 240GB drive. I saw no need to order the latest, fastest SSD on the market since my laptop is well over ten years old now. Its SATA interface would not support the latest speeds as far as I could determine. Mint boots in about half the time now...37 seconds and altogether its 55 seconds from power on to Google's home page online. Satisfied with purchase so far, hopefully I have a good drive.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want an easy time
customer_reviews.text: The drive itself works okay but having to find and use free cloning software is a huge headache. I have tried cloning my original drive with Macrium Reflect like others recommend but the drive will not boot and it refuses to copy every file. The cloned partition is always 4 GB smaller than the original and it says windows is missing files and windows recovery disk does not work. I've bought 6 samsung SSDs and every clone with their software worked flawless. Next time I will gladly pay more and save myself the time and headache.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost upgrade from hdd for fast boot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my gaming desktop to upgrade my boot (Win10) drive from a mechanical hdd Boot time is massively faster than mechanical drive I've got a couple games on it but don't really notice a difference from mechanical hdd, though those have been recent console ports that are CPU bottlenecked (Phenom 955 x4, 16gb RAM, GTX 980) Got the 240gb cuz it was a cheap upgrade to fast boot times and my Steam games are on a secondary mechanical 1tb drive
customer_reviews.author: Gaming, 4x4, IT guy

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly on old PowerMac G5
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly on a dual 2.7GHz PowerMac G5 running OS 10.5. After connecting it inside the drivebay (I didn't even bother with a 2.5->3.5inch adapter), closing everything up and booting I was able to see the disk in Disk Utility and format it. The thing took SECONDS to format (partition) and was then fully usable. Zero issues using it as a Pro Tools recording drive, it's as if the whole session was in RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra176

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is, but there are better options out there
customer_reviews.text: I needed an SSD to fix a client's computer. Worked as it should. Faster than a traditional mechanical hard drive for sure. However, there are other brands out there like Silicon Power, ADATA, and even Crucial that are the same capacity, are less expensive, and utilize 3D NAND technology - which makes them a little better in terms of energy efficiency and speed. I got this because it offered next day delivery. Don't get me wrong, it works and works well - I just feel there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T.

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used many of the 120gb and 240gb models for desktop and laptop builds. Some have many hours on them, no issues with a single one. I don't think you can go wrong with these for the price. The Samsung 500gb EVO SSD would be a step up from these, and would be better if you are storing critical data. Otherwise, for gaming or basic use, these Kingston SSDs are more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: chickenlady

product_meta.title: Kingston 120GB A400 SATA 3 2.5" Internal SSD SA400S37/120G - HDD Replacement for Increase Performance
product_meta.description: Style:SATA3| Capacity:120 GBIncredible speeds plus rock-solid reliability - Kingston's A400 solid-state drive dramatically improves the responsiveness of your existing system with incredible boot, loading and file transfer times compared to mechanical hard drives. Powered by a latest gen controller for read and write speeds up to 500MB/s and 450MB/s, this SSD is 10x faster than a traditional hard drive for higher performance, ultra-responsive multi-tasking and an overall faster system. Also more reliable and durable than a hard drive, A400 is built with Flash memory. There are no moving parts, making it less likely to fail than a mechanical hard drive. It's also cooler and quieter, and its shock and vibration resistance makes it ideal for notebooks and other mobile computing devices. A400 is available in multiple capacities from 120GB-480GB to give you all the space you need for applications, videos, photos and other important documents. You can also replace your hard drive or a smaller SSD with a drive big enough to hold all your files. Backwards compatibility to SATA Rev. 2.0 (3Gb/s).
feature_bullets: Fast start up, loading and file transfers
More reliable and durable than a hard drive
Multiple capacities with space for applications or a hard drive replacement
SSD must be initialized and formatted to enable host computer and applications to access the drive.
Use Windows Disk Management tool, or MacOS Disk Utility app, or Linux compatible disk partition utility to initialize and format new SSD.
Fresh install operating system from distribution media to SSD, or use data cloning software to migrate data from source drive to SSD.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars47,143 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
